title.narrative: INCLUSIVE SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Strengthened national and subnational human and institutional capacities to develop and deliver inclusive and equitable social protection systems to strengthen the resilience of and protect boys and girls from all forms of poverty and social exclusion., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national systems and policies are effectively addressing multiple deprivations affecting the most vulnerable boys and girls across the lifecycle, and building their resilience, through adequately funded social investments and rights-based quality social policies on the basis of adequately disaggregated data on children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national and subnational human and institutional capacities to develop and deliver inclusive and equitable socialprotection systems to strengthen the resilience of and protect boys and girls from all forms of poverty and social exclusion.

description.narrative: UNICEF Eastern Caribbean Area (ECA) provided effective technical and financial support in the area of social protection (SP) at policy, programme and administrative levels. As a result, capacity was strengthened for national stakeholders of nine countries and territories in the Eastern Caribbean to design more child-sensitive and shock-responsive social protection programmes and systems and to leverage their social protection systems in response to emergencies. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:18/01/2022
